p: Plants which are found to be medicinally effective and frequently traditionally administered may include substances that are possible drug candidates. Therefore, they should be intensively reviewed. In different countries, scientific research of medicinal plants has been conducted due to their effective role to health care ( Heinrich et al., 1998, Cunningham, 1993, Gazzaneo et al., 2005, Cai et al., 2006, Aqil et al., 2006). The active compounds differ from plant to plant due to their biodiversity and they produce a definite physiological action on the human body ( Edeoga et al., 2006, Borokini and Omotayo, 2012). Moreover, the distribution of these chemical compounds in the different plant parts differs ( Bako et al., 2005, Borokini and Omotayo, 2012). Thus, the medicinal content in medicinal plants is affected primarily by cultivation period, season of collection ( Nalawade and Tsay, 2004). Therefore, phytochemical screening must be carried out regularly, even on plants whose secondary metabolites are known.
